findings.title: Incorrect implementation due to mixing of token value and native-coin value in multiTransferEther function
findings.description: The multiTransferEther function incorrectly validates the amount of native coins transferred, which could lead to the theft of the native coins in the NyxMultiSend (MultiTransferEtherToken) contract.

findings.title: KingdomStoryMarket design issue
findings.description: Three design issues in the Market: 1) No validation of signature messages used in TRADE, allowing reuse and unauthorized trades; 2) No validation of msg.value when trading with a NATIVE_TOKEN.

findings.title: Insufficient data in sign messages leads to potential signature issues
findings.description: The lack of information in the signature messages used in kingdomNFT contracts can lead to three potential security issues: unintended function usage, unintended contract usage, and reuse across chains.

findings.title: KingdomStoryMysteryBox unsafe random value
findings.description: The random value used by the KingdomStoryMysteryBox contract can be predictable.

findings.title: UnlockAndBurn function without owner authentication implemented
findings.description: Owner authentication does not exist in the UnlockAndBurn function, so anyone can burn another user's locked KingdomStoryHeroNFT.

findings.title: KingdomStoryHeroNFT contract reentrancy
findings.description: A reentrancy issue in the MsSafeMint, MsSafeMintMulti, SafeMintBoxResult, and MintHero functions of the KingdomStoryHero NFT contract leads to several possible attacks.

findings.title: KingdomStoryHeroNFT signature reuse issue 1
findings.description: An attacker can reuse a signature issued to another user in the UnlockAndSetTokenURI/MintHero function because there is no information (address) in the signature data that can identify an Account.

findings.title: KingdomStoryHeroNFT signature reuse issue 2
findings.description: An attacker can reuse the signature in different functions of UnlockAndSetTokenURI / MintHero.

findings.title: KingdomStoryHeroNFT-UnlockAndSetTokenURI insufficient tokenId validation
findings.description: An attacker can overwrite arbitrary token URI information in the KingdomStoryHeroNFT contract due to lack of tokenId validation in the UnlockAndSetTokenURI function.

findings.title: Upgradeable issue
findings.description: The KingdomStoryBKT, KingdomStoryHeroNFT, KingdomStoryKID, KingdomStoryMarket, and KingdomStoryMysteryBox contracts use the OpenZeppelin Initializable module but do not call the _disableInitializers function in the constructor of the Implementation contract.

findings.title: Function/Variables Naming Style
findings.description: The kingdomNFT contracts have function names and variable names that violate solidity's naming style.

findings.title: Unused Functions
findings.description: An unused mint function exists for the KingdomStoryHeroNFT and KingdomStoryMysteryBox contracts.

findings.title: Non-Implemented Pausable Functions
findings.description: The KingdomStoryMysteryBox contract inherited the PausableUpgradeable contract and uses the whenNotPaused modifier in the _beforeTokenTransfer function, but the pause/unpause function is not implemented.

findings.title: Missing event logging in several functions
findings.description: Important functions that set and modify master and contracts{nft/box/market} information do not emit events, making transaction auditing and incident response more difficult.

findings.title: KingdomStoryMysteryBox contract reentrancy
findings.description: The BuyBox function of the KingdomStoryMysteryBox contract has a reentrancy issue due to an external call occurring when the callback function (onERC721Received) is called, allowing the function of the KingdomStoryHeroNFT contract to be executed again inside the external call.
